Node.definition: = man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

= linear measure, corresponding to the length of the forearm, from the tip of the middle finger to the point of the elbow; the exact measure is uncertain; apparently there were two standards: the normal, estimated as 44.5 cm; and the royal, estimated as 51.81 cm

= linear measure, corresponding to the length of the forearm, from the tip of the middle finger to the point of the elbow; the exact measure is uncertain; apparently there were two standards: the normal, estimated as 44.5 cm; and the royal, estimated as 51.81 cm
= state in which a countable entity is six in number
= a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream
= plain in Babylon (בָּבֶל) ► where Nebuchadnezzar set up a large golden image
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= town; ◄ in Mesopotamia (שִׁנְעָר) ► founded by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) location of tower of Babel; capital of Chaldean (כַּשְׂדִּים) empire
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= causative action by which humans summon other humans to come to one place for common purpose
= person in charge of part of the Persian empire
= a person of authority
= person providing counsel to someone in authority
= an official entrusted with the oversight of the funds and treasures of a king

= a person whose responsibility it is to give a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensure that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in vindication for the innocent and punishment for the guilty
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= to move to a certain location, seen from that location's perspective
= action by which humans make a building or religious object ready for use ◄ usually by devoting it to a deity
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= referent pointing to a point in time, usually in reference to another event
= action by which humans come together in one place for a common purpose
= person in charge of part of the Persian empire
= a person of authority
= person providing counsel to someone in authority
= an official entrusted with the oversight of the funds and treasures of a king

= a person whose responsibility it is to give a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensure that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in vindication for the innocent and punishment for the guilty
= an adminstrative division of a country or a city
= action by which humans make a building or religious object ready for use ◄ usually by devoting it to a deity
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= man; ◄ son of Nabopolassar; ► king of Babylon (בָּבֶל) from 605 562 B.C. who led the people of Judah (יְהוּדָה) into exile
= an official with the task to make proclamations on behalf of a king or leader
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a large body of people united by common descent
literally: tongue; hence: = a system of communication used by a community, ethnic group, or nation
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time, from a moment to a year or longer
= something that can be heard; ◄ produced by humans, directly or with the help of a musical instrument ► in order to communicate a message
= wind instrument; ◄ made out of the horn of a male sheep
musical instrument consisting of one or two tubes with a series of finger holes used to alter the tone; sound is produced by blowing across an opening in the tube
= a stringed musical instrument whose exact identification is unsure; perhaps a kind of harp or lyre
= triangular musical instrument with 4 strings and a bright tone
= stringed instrument in triangular shape, perhaps a kind of harp; psaltery; harp; harp

probably some sort of musical instrument; perhaps:bagpipe, consisting of two flute type pipes connected to an air bag, which was inflated by a third pipe; or, a large drum; or a term referring to the whole ensemble of musical instruments
= a group of items sharing similar characteristics
= generic term for musical instrument
= action by which humans assume a lying position, often in order to show respect, allegiance, or devotion
= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= action by which humans lay themselves down on the ground in front of another human or a deity, ► as an act of submission or respect
= action by which humans cause (other) humans or objects to move in a particular direction, usually with force
= a reference to a location inside of a three dimensional space

= a construction, probably with a hole at the top and a door in its side, ◄ made of hardened clay, bricks, or metal, ► in which fuel such as charcoal, wood, or dried grass, is burned, used to burn criminals to death

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= state in which a fire (אֵשׁ) is burning up the combustible materials fueling it; ≈ associated with anger

Node.gloss: to approach|to come near|to come forward
Node.definition: = action by which humans or animals move to a location relatively close to the location in focus
= a male human
= descendant of Chesed (כֶּשֶׂד) son of Nahor (נָחֹור) and their land
literally, to eat pieces (of someone)
literally: to eat a piece (of someone); hence: = action by which humans accuse others with malicious intent
= member of tribe of Judah (יְהוּדָה) inhabitant of the kingdom of Judah; after the exile referring to all descendants of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
